hmm.. re: my earlier error apparently I needed to reinstall Docker.  weird
<@U2CBG8V9U|humblealex> has joined the channel
can we modify the .yaml file which is inside the chaincode after deploying it to the chain
<@U22RH7VGT> that config is for the membersrvc component, not the chaincode. Please read the README here: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/examples/chaincode/go/asset_management02>
Basically, the asset.yaml is used by the asset_management02_test.go test (use go test to run the test) to configure the membersrvc with the necessary identities
<@U0KM61BCP>  yes ofcource but if i am adding some user after deploying the chaincode in the chain and i want to give access to the user for that chaincode can that be done
not yet, there is, I believe, a patch being reviewed to add dynamic addition of users via the SDK
the config approach is just for testing

<@U0ULK2JPP|muralisr> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/muralisr/F2CCN8U03/pasted_image_at_2016_09_16_07_57_am.png|Pasted image at 2016-09-16, 7:57 AM> and commented: <@U0KM61BCP> <@U11HH3P7Y> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1057/3> is failing on bdd tests.. I thought bdd test failures are ignored now ?

CLI or REST ?

SDK is probably the best approach
<@U0KM61BCP>
thanks I will take a look
ibm-blockchain-js is not the same thing as the new SDK HFC...correct ?
no, the ibm-blockchain-js was written before the node SDK (hfc). I don't believe that it is current with master. It is pegged to what was running in Bluemix (v0.5).

the code for that should be merged within the next day or so.

text: <@U0KM61BCP> I'm trying this: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/nodeSDK/node-sdk-self-contained.md>
<@U2CFEGHV3|arconederveen> has joined the channel
but I get errors with the docker-compose file
ERROR: In file './docker-compose.yml', service 'links' must be a mapping not an array.
ERROR: In file './docker-compose.yml', service 'tty' must be a mapping not a boolean.
does anyone know a quick fix for these ?

<@U1CTBUNEN>  - my guess is that you did a cut and paste directly from the html page you posted above.   Basically when you do that it did not preserve formatting.   Easiest thing to do is to hit the "Raw" button and then copy the contents from there (you'll see that you now have proper indentation / formatting)
<@U0PB67X4K> well the reason I copied and pasted was because the link was broken: <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hyperledger/fabric/master/examples/sdk/node/example02/docker-compose.yml>
I get a 404 for that
yeah - figured that.  so just view the "Raw" content of that page and copy the contents from there and you should be good (at least format wise)
<@U2C55KE65|arvin> has joined the channel
<@U1CTBUNEN> hold off on that a sec… I am preparing an environment for you
the docs are a bit off
<@U0KM61BCP> ok thanks
<@U28GV4VQD|andriian> has joined the channel
<@U1CTBUNEN> still working on this… I upgraded by Docker to 1.12.1 and something’s not right…
<@U0KM61BCP> - what error are you seeing?
does `hyperledger/fabric-node-sdk` actually exist?
<@U0KM61BCP> we haven't been able to make docker > 1.8 work for CI
<@U0PB67X4K>: it exists but I don't think they've merged yet
Yeah no merged commits <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/q/project:fabric-sdk-node>

I'm trying out HL outside of development mode for the first time using multiple VPs.  When I try to deploy my chaincode, I'm seeing errors like the following in the `peer` console.  

```
18:20:01.840 [dockercontroller] Start -> ERRO 036 start-could not recreate container cannot connect to Docker endpoint
18:20:01.840 [chaincode] Launch -> ERRO 037 launchAndWaitForRegister failed Error stating container: cannot connect to Docker endpoint
18:20:01.840 [consensus/pbft] execDoneSync -> INFO 038 Replica 3 finished execution 3 trying next
```

Any ideas or suggestions?  Thanks!
<@U23S3DPFY> you probably need to set CORE_VM_ENDPOINT to the right docker daemon endpoint. It defaults to unix:///var/run/docker.sock.

I was following the instructions for the block-listener example.  This is the command line I used to instantiate the first docker container: `docker run --rm -it -e CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:2375> -e CORE_PEER_ID=vp0 -e CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true -e CORE_PEER_VALIDATOR_CONSENSUS_PLUGIN=pbft hyperledger/fabric-peer peer node start`
What is supposed to be listening on port 2375?  Is that docker itself?  Maybe I need start some service on my docker host?
docker daemon
you need to pass the `-H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375>` argument when you start the daemon
thanks!  I had to reinstall Docker due to an issue last night and it looks like the settings the devenv `setup.sh` script installs got blown away

Argh!!  I applied the changes to the `/etc/default/docker` file and am now back to the error that made me reinstall Docker last night.  `syslog` shows that the Docker daemon is just continually restarting
Apparently the `-s aufs` option was breaking things.
hey- who’s the admin for JIRA for the fabric? Need to reset my password and apparently need an admin to do that. Thanks
sbarclay go to <http://identity.linuxfoundation.org|identity.linuxfoundation.org> and do a password recovery/reset
ah- sweet. thanks <@U0UHG4VP1>

<@U23S3DPFY> what version of docker are u using? Can u try the following configuration? it works from Docker 1.9.0 ~ 1.12.1 in my local environment. DOCKER_OPTS="$DOCKER_OPTS -H <tcp://0.0.0.0:2375> -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock --api-cors-header='*' "

Docker v1.12.1.  I am using the Vagrant/devenv scripts to set everything up but trying to run in an AWS EC2 VM.  The problem I seem to be having is that the scripts update the kernel, and afterwards once I reboot Docker is broken.  Docker works okay once the setup is complete as long as I don't reboot.

<@U0Z41KY5V> Thanks for the suggestion though.  I was able to start Docker with those settings but then got a build error when running the tests.  I wasn't sure if it might be due to leaving off the `-s aufs` Docker option.
can i know what os are u using?
Unfortunately, while I'm familiar with the Docker concept this is more or less my first time getting hands-on experience.
Ubuntu 14.04
if you’re not quite familar with docker/vagrant before, i would suggest u try another option, maybe a little simpler than this way.
please feel free to have a look at <https://github.com/yeasy/docker-compose-files/tree/master/hyperledger>.

text: I'm very familiar with Vagrant and that worked fine.  I just don't have a lot of memory on my laptop so would like to get things working at AWS.
Will take a look...
it totally utilizes Docker without vagrant and local building.
what u need is just to find a vm, and just `bash setupPbft.sh` to do some simple setup :slightly_smiling_face:
nice!  Thanks for sharing
vagrant needs to create vm, hence not that convenient within vm.
sure, enjoy and welcome for feedbacks. The scripts have been evaluated for half a year.
<@U0Z41KY5V> It looks like your Docker Compose files depend on Docker containers you have posted to Docker Hub.  How often do you refresh them?
<@U23S3DPFY> <@U0KPFAZNF> just pushed <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc/tags/> and <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-peer/tags/> today with 0.6 bits, if it helps you
it’s automatically built by triggering, hence will be very frequently. <@U23S3DPFY>
<@U0UHG4VP1> Great, when can we have the z and ppc images?
baohua: ghaskins is working on that, but right now we don’t have Z builders
sure, and about the naming of the image, can we put the release number at the head? e.g., 0.6.0-preview-x86_64?
this will be convininent for sorting and searching.
convenient :slightly_smiling_face:
There is a proposal to move the $arch out of the tag and into the name
That would have similar impact
But the final schema still needs to be agreed upon
sure, noticed it, and we can highlight that at the proposal. <@U0KPFAZNF>

Guys, can we fire Rest APi with something like this ?
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"query","id":"5","params":{"type":1,"chaincodeID":{"name":"testscName"},"ctorMsg":{"function":"CreateRoleWithoutPC","args":*[[],["GE5","GEO 5","","","20090211","20091231","1","235959"]]*},"secureContext":"jim"}}
args as a 2 dimensional array ??
is this supported ?
CLI does not seem to support. Its showing  *Error: Chaincode argument error: json: cannot unmarshal array into Go value of type string*
anyone can help ?

<@U1CS08EP3>  I think for now you can only pass an array of strings via the REST API.  While a bit crude,  you could always turn your more complicated structure into a string and then unpack it yourself in your chaincode.

On a different topic, I noticed that the README for the Blockchain Explorer doesn't render correctly on the Github site.  New lines are not shown in the quoted text due to incorrect markdown being used.  I'd like to submit the trivial fix for this.

1.  Do I need to raise a Jira issue to be able to submit this fix?  2.  If so, do I create one under the general Fabric project?  The explorer is a standalone project at the moment, but I don't see it identified as a project in Jira.
oh, If its not identified as a part of Hyperledger, then i guess it wont be associated in jira as well.
we should bring it to the notice of <@U0KM61BCP> . Chris should be able to take care of that..
Just to be clear, I am referring to this (which is now a mirror of a Gerrit repository): <https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer>
i got it,. looks like a small miss while creating the Jira projects
